snippet: With the nourishing downpours of the monsoon season down an average of 12 percent across India, farmers are on the brink of disaster.
abstract: India is experiencing its fourth drought in 12 years; nourishing downpours of the monsoon season are down an average of 12 percent across the country, and farmers are on the brink of disaster; some scientists warn that such calamities are part of a trend that is likely to intensify in the coming decades because of climate changes caused by greenhouse gas emissions.

byline.contributor: Neha Thirani contributed research from Mumbai.

lead_paragraph: With the nourishing downpours of the monsoon season down an average of 12 percent across India, farmers are on the brink of disaster.
